intro: Boechera elkoensis, commonly known as the Elko rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Great Basin region of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Boechera elkoensis has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. It is a perennial plant that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
